events.name: Android Things
events.description: Android Things is an extension of the Android platform for IoT and embedded devices. It joins the family of Mobile, Wear, TV, and Auto to bring Android to new form factors. With Android Things, developers can leverage the best-in-class multimedia, connectivity, and rich UI to simplify and accelerate the development of IoT applications.

venue.name: ISIMS (Higher Institute of Computer Science and Multimedia of Sfax)
venue.address_1: pôle technologique de sfax, Sakiet Ezzit, Sfax

events.description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Registration: http://devfest.ieee.tn/

events.name: Web study jams (Mobile sites certifications)
events.description:
• What we'll do
The Study Jams objective is to raise the technical proficiency of global community members through the highest possible course completion rate.

Why do I need great mobile web skills?
Mobile now accounts for over half of all web traffic. Users expect their small-screen experiences to be as quick and intuitive as those on desktop. But making the mobile web fast and easy takes some special skills.
53% of mobile visitors will leave if a page takes more than three seconds to load. The average page takes 22 seconds to load, so collectively we're losing a lot of mobile users and giving them a bad experience along the way. Speed is only one part of the picture when creating great mobile experiences.

Why invest in a Mobile Sites Certification?
Opportunity: Most websites are not ready for Smartphone-first users

• What to bring
laptops

• Important to know

events.name: Hash Code @ENIS
events.description:
• What we'll do
Hash Code is a team programming competition organized by Google for students and industry professionals across Europe, the Middle East and Africa. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a Google engineering problem for you to solve.
The competition takes place over two rounds:
> Thursday, 1st March 2018
18:30 to 22:30 CET
Online Qualification Round. Your team can participate from one of our competition hubs or from wherever else you’d like.

> Saturday, 28th April 2018
9:30 to 21:30 CET
Final Round. Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will be invited to Google Dublin to compete in the Final Round of the competition.

Further details: https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/

• What to bring
laptop

• Important to know
Registration link: https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/signup.html
Find a team and sign up now to participate in the 2018 edition of Hash Code! Registration is free of charge and will close on 26th February 2018 at 18:00 CET.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
• What we'll do
Study Jams are community-run study groups for students on Google Developers content, on various product topics. The objective of Study Jams is to raise the technical proficiency of our global community members through the highest possible course completion rate.
Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members together to learn something in person. These trainings will give the participants a specific skill they can use for personal development or career advancement.
The participants will:
- Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
- Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
- Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
- Get Google-hosted badges for their online profiles, to show potential employers what they know about Cloud computing.

Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

• What to bring
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

• Important to know
Agenda:
08:30_10:00 Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
10:00_10:30 Coffee Break
10:30_12:00 Scientific Data Processing lab
12:00_13 :00 Lunch Break
13:00_14:30 Intro to Docker
14 :30 Event Ends

events.name: IWD'18_Sfax
events.description:
Google Developer Group and Women Techmakers Sfax are celebrating the International Women's Day ( IWD ) on April 14, 2018, at the National School of Engineers in Sfax (ENIS).
A lot of surprises and amazing things are waiting for you!
Stay tuned for more details...

events.name: I/O Extended Sfax
events.description:
Google I/O is an annual event hosted by Google to highlight the latest in technology and product innovation. This covers topics such as the IoT, working with material design, advancements in mobile technology, Machine Learning and so much more.

I/O Extended 2018 is an event that aims to put together the developers community in Sfax to discuss and learn about the new technologies introduced at Google I/O 2018.

Agenda:
-Google I/O Recap: New Google products & technology Announcements
- CodeLab Session
- Open Talk with GDG Members

events.name: 2018 GDG DEVFEST Sfax - Smart Cities Hackathon
events.description:
GDG DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies.
It is our pleasure to call for participation to 2018 GDG DevFest Sfax with focus on Smart cities. DevFest is an annual event run by Google Developer Group chapters worldwide. It is an event for developers, by developers.

Website: http://devfest.ieee.tn
Pre-Registration: FREE https://goo.gl/forms/qDxc0YDFGtGmCoP13

events.name: Cloud Computing in Emerging Markets
events.description:
You are kindly invited for a conference on Novembre 1st, 10 am @ the incubator of technopark of Sfax, CoStarT.
Theme « Cloud Computing in Emerging Markets: Leveraging Technology to Scale Businesses & Transform Economies ».

Keynote speaker : Albert Sanders, Manager global public policy strategy for Google Cloud.
https://www.linkedin.com/in/albert-sanders-72911694/

The event is organized by the Technopark of Sfax.

events.name: Hackathon Radio Sfax
events.description:
A l’occasion de son 57 ème anniversaire, Radio Sfax lance le deuxième marathon (Hackthon Radio-Sfax 2018). Cette compétition amicale vise à expérimenter des innovations technologiques, de nouveaux concepts de développement et de créativité dans un contexte collaboratif, libre et convivial.
Sur une période de trois jours, les participants provenant de différents domaines liés au numérique combinent leurs habiletés à relaisser un produit sonore et visuel pour l’habillage d’antenne et l’habillage d’émissions de radio Sfax.

Ce concours de réalisation s’adresse aux étudiants : musiciens, designers, techniciens développeurs, et les personnes créatives, ainsi qu’à tous ceux et celles qui évoluent dans le domaine de création audio-visuelle.
En équipe de 3 à 5 personnes, les participants élaborent un produit audiovisuel pour habiller l’antenne, émissions et le web radio.

CHALLENGES!
1- Prix d’habillage antenne

Création d’un produit audio-visuel (en FM et sur internet) pour l’identité de radio Sfax (Spot promo général) <link>, <link> et qui répond au besoin suivantes :

Renforcer la visibilité de la radio ;
Décliner sa signature sonore ;
Affirmer ses différences face à la concurrence ;
Valoriser et dynamiser sa grille de programmes ;
Rendre les contenus d’émission plus attractive et plus accessible;
Durée du sport promo entre 20 et 30 s.

2- Prix d’habillage émissions

Création d’un produit en FM et sur internet pour identifier les émissions : matinal « ahla sabeh » <link>, de la soirée « mesaa elkhir tounis » <link> et de l’émission ramadanesque « tahiyat ramadan» <link> .Ce produit doit être composé d’ensemble des éléments sonores tels que (générique, jingles, virgules, tapis) et doit tenir compte des paramètres suivants:

contexte de diffusion
concept de la station (grille générale des programmes)
genre d’émission (informations, divertissements…)
type d’auditeur (tranche d’âge, statut socio-économique, profil culturel)
horaire de diffusion (matin, soir),
jour de la semaine,
période de l’année (saison, jours de fêtes, ramadan),
événements médiatiques (sportif, type coupe du monde; culturel, type
sortie mondiale d’un film).
Pour le produit en FM la durée entre 15 et 20 s
Pour le produit sur internet la durée entre 25 et 30 s

3- Prix d’un jeu sérieux

Développement d’un jeu sérieux paramétrable (sonore et visuel) pour l’exploiter dans les émissions radio.
4- Prix pour une application informatique

Développement d’une application informatique (multilingue arabe et français) permettant d’envoyer et de gérer des éléments sonores et images vers un serveur web .Cette application est composée de deux modules :

Une application android, destinée aux auditeurs radio de Sfax (front office) qui sera publier sur le play store. Cette application est composé d’un formulaire permettant la saisie du nom, prénom de l’auditeur , une description de son intervention et d’une action de capture d’image ou séquence sonore. En plus la possibilité de sauvegarde des deux localisations (de l’image acquise et de l’auditeur lors de l’envoie de son message), l’heure et la date,
Une application web permettant de gérer les éléments reçus (back office).

Website: http://radiosfax.ieee.tn/

events.name: Cloud Study Jam 2019 (ML API - Intoductory)

venue.name: National School of Engineers of Sfax

events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want
Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

events.name: Hash Code 2019 - Online Qualification Round
events.description:
Hash Code is a team programming competition, organized by Google, for students and professionals around the world. You pick your team and programming language and we pick an engineering problem for you to solve. This year’s contest kicks off with an Online Qualification Round, where your team can compete from wherever you’d like, including from one of our Hash Code hubs. Top teams will then be invited to a Google office for the Final Round.

Think you could optimize the layout of a Google Data Center? How about scheduling a fleet of drones to make deliveries around the world? Tackle an engineering problem from Google during Hash Code, our team programming competition. Are you up for the challenge?

Registration: https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode/register

events.name: International Women's Day ( IWD )
events.description: Let's celebrate International Women's Day together! During the first week of March, we will feature some of the women of IEEE SIGHT in honor of International Women's Day - a global day celebrating the social, economic, cultural and political achievements of women.
